com.group10b.blueka.bluetooth

Class BleAdvertiser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group10b.blueka.bluetooth.BleAdvertiser

  • public class BleAdvertiser
extends java.lang.Object
    An Wrapper for all activity of advertising. The device are expected to be an scanner, if nothing can be scanned, then the device will be an advertiser instead.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BleAdvertiser.GattServerCallback
      An object to handled all the events in Gatt connection after the advertiser connected by a scanner.

      long getServerMusicTime(long currentSystemTime)
      This method captures the current time on the device and adds a certain value (e.g 6000 ms) to it in order to obtain a future timestamp to play the snippet.

      This method takes the timestamp at which the server device is set to play the music and adjust the time according to the offset value

    • Method Detail

      • updateResultConsumer

        public void updateResultConsumer(ScanResultsConsumer src)
        A method to pass the interface to the MainActivity. Any update from the Bluetooth Advertiser will be use this method to update the user interface.
        Parameters:
        src -

      • setupServer

        private void setupServer()
        Set up the server for advertiser to advertises. Settings of the server will be set here as well.

      • startAdvertising

        public void startAdvertising()
        MainActivity can call this method to let the advertiser start advertising the server.

      • stopAdvertising

        public void stopAdvertising()
        This method can be called by MainActivity to make the advertiser stop advertise.

      • isAdvertising

        public boolean isAdvertising()
        A boolean method to check if the advertiser advertising.
        Returns:
        true if the advertiser advertising, else false.

        A method to close the server.

      • getServerMusicTime

        public long getServerMusicTime(long currentSystemTime)
        This method captures the current time on the device and adds a certain value (e.g 6000 ms) to it in order to obtain a future timestamp to play the snippet.
        Parameters:
        currentSystemTime - the current time on the device
        Returns:
        a future time to play the music

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp(long serverMusicTime)
        This method takes the timestamp at which the server device is set to play the music and adjust the time according to the offset value
        Parameters:
        serverMusicTime - system time at which the server device shall play the snippet
        Returns:
        atomic time at which the server shall play the music
